thread.title: Calendar: What investors need to know for the week ahead
thread.title_full: Calendar: What investors need to know for the week ahead - The Globe and Mail

author: The Globe and Mail
title: Calendar: What investors need to know for the week ahead
text:
A A A daily rundown of the economic reports and corporate earnings that will be grabbing the market's attention in the week ahead.
Monday September 28
Japan leading index
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. personal spending and personal income for August. Consensus is increases of 0.3 per cent and 0.4 per cent from July, respectively.
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. core personal consumption expenditures price index for August. Consensus is an increase of 0.1 per cent from July and 1.3 per cent year over year.
(10 a.m. ET) U.S. pending home sales for August. Consensus is an increase of 0.5 per cent from previous month.
Earnings include: Advanced Drainage Systems Inc.; Synnex Corp.; Vail Resorts Inc.
Tuesday September 29
Euro area economic confidence
Germany consumer price index
(8:30 a.m. ET) Canada industrial product price index and raw materials price index for August. Estimates are declines of 1 per cent and 8 per cent from July, respectively
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. goods trade deficit for August. Estimate is $56-billion, down from $59.2-billion in July.
(9 a.m. ET) U.S. S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for July. Consensus is an increase of 0.1 per cent from June and 5.1 per cent year over year.
(10 a.m. ET) U.S. Conference Board consumer confidence index for September. Consensus is 96.5, down from 101.5 in August
Earnings include: Cantel Medical Corp.; Costco Wholesale Corp.; IHS Inc.;
Wednesday September 30
Japan industrial production and retail sales
Euro area unemployment rate and CPI
(8:15 a.m. ET) U.S. ADP national employment report for September. Consensus is an increase of 188,000, down 2,000 from August
(8:30 a.m. ET) Canada real GDP at basic prices for July. Consensus is an increase of 0.2 per cent from June.
(9:45 a.m. ET) U.S. Chicago PMI for September. Consensus is 53.1, down 1.3 from August
(10:30 a.m. ET) EIA petroleum status report
Earnings include: Actuant Corp.; Paychex Inc.
Thursday October 1
China to release PMI date and its stock markets are closed
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. initial jobless claims for week of Sept. 26. Estimate is an increase of 5,000 from week of Sept. 19.
(9:30 a.m. ET) Canada RBC manufacturing PMI for September
(10 a.m. ET) U.S. manufacturing ISM for September. Consensus for PMI is 50.7, down from 51.1 in August. For prices paid, consensus is 40.0, compared to 39.0 for the previous month
Also expected: Canada auto sales for September
Earnings include: McCormick & Company Inc.; Micron Technology Inc.; Progress Software Corp.; Theratechnologies Inc.
Friday October 2
Japan jobless rate and household spending
Euro area producer price index
China markets closed
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. nonfarm payrolls for September. Consensus is an increase of 200,000, up from 173,000 in August
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. unemployment rate for September. Consensus is 5.1 per cent, unchanged from August.
(8:30 a.m. ET) U.S. average hourly earnings for September. Consensus is an increase of 0.2 per cent from August.
Follow us on Twitter: @GlobeInvestor
